state_analysis: The command to check system processes has timed out again, indicating that the terminal environment remains unresponsive. This consistent issue suggests a severe problem with the Docker installation or the host operating system, which is preventing any command execution.
explanation: Since all previous attempts to diagnose and resolve the Docker issues through commands have failed, I will now consider the option of completely uninstalling and then reinstalling Docker. This step will help ensure that any corrupted files or configurations are cleared. After the reinstallation, I will check if the Docker service starts correctly and if commands can be executed successfully.

commands.keystrokes: sudo apt-get purge docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
